item.title: New Zealand Shouldn't Cut Rates for 'Prolonged Period,' IMF Says
item.description: IMF Advises New Zealand’s Central Bank to Keep Interest Rates High The International Monetary Fund (IMF) has advised New Zealand’s central bank, the Reserve Bank of New Zealand (RBNZ), not to cut interest rates for a “prolonged period”. The IMF said in a report released on Wednesday that the RBNZ has “appropriately” raised interest rates by 1.

item.title: New Zealand Current Account Deficit Narrows
item.description: New Zealand’s annual current account deficit narrowed in the first quarter of 2023, from 9% of gross domestic product (GDP) to 8.5%. The narrowing of the deficit was due to a number of factors, including the return of tourists and international students following the pandemic, which boosted services exports.

item.title: Five Things You Need to Know to Start Your Day
item.description: Five Things You Need to Know to Start Your Day New Zealand’s annual current account deficit narrowed in the first quarter of 2023. This is a positive sign for the economy, as it suggests that the economy is recovering from the pandemic.

item.title: New Zealand Sees Record Immigration Surge
item.description: New Zealand Sees Record Immigration Surge New Zealand saw a record surge in immigration in April, with 10,100 people arriving in the country. This was the biggest increase in immigration since 2019, and it took the country’s net migration rate to 0.
